Package fr.rphstudio.codingdojo.game.functions

Interface ShipStatus

public interface ShipStatus
STATUS FUNCTIONS
This module gathers all functions needed to get information about the ship movements. You can get the position (X or Y), the direction angle, the speed magnitude or the speed vector components (X or Y). You can also get the Boost and Battery level values.
Author:
Romuald GRIGNON

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    float getShipAngle()
    Gets the current ship orientation (Code Level #--).
    The angle is in degrees. 0 means the ship goes toward the Right edge of the screen, along the X-axis
    float getShipAngle​(int index)
    This function is the same than getShipAngle() but for a specific ship (Code Level #--).
    The ship index is given in parameter.
    float getShipBatteryLevel()
    Gets the level of the ship battery (Code Level #--).
    Depending on the race mode, the energy consumption can be enabled, and you must take care of your battery level.
    float getShipBatteryLevel​(int index)
    This function is the same than getShipBatteryLevel() but for a specific ship (Code Level #--).
    The ship index is given in parameter.
    float getShipBoostLevel()
    Gets the boost charge level.
    float getShipBoostLevel​(int index)
    This function is the same than getShipBoostLevel() but for a specific ship (Code Level #--).
    The ship index is given in parameter.
    float getShipPositionX()
    Gets the X-axis position for the current ship (Code Level #--).
    Remember the Left edge of the screen is the X=0 position, and the X increases toward the Right edge.
    float getShipPositionX​(int index)
    This function is the same than getShipPositionX() but for a specific ship (Code Level #--).
    The ship index is given in parameter.
    float getShipPositionY()
    Gets the Y-axis position for the current ship (Code Level #--).
    Remember the Top edge of the screen is the Y=0 position, and the Y increases toward the Bottom edge.
    float getShipPositionY​(int index)
    This function is the same than getShipPositionY() but for a specific ship (Code Level #--).
    float getShipSpeed()
    Gets the speed magnitude for the current ship (Code Level #--).
    float getShipSpeed​(int index)
    This function is the same than getShipSpeed() but for a specific ship (Code Level #--).
    The ship index is given in parameter.
    float getShipSpeedX()
    Gets the X-axis component of the current ship speed vector (Code Level #--).
    Remember a positive value means the vector points toward the Right edge of the screen.
    float getShipSpeedX​(int index)
    This function is the same than getShipSpeedX() but for a specific ship (Code Level #--).
    The ship index is given in parameter.
    float getShipSpeedY()
    Gets the Y-axis component of the current ship speed vector (Code Level #--).
    Remember a positive value means the vector points toward the Bottom edge of the screen.

    This function is the same than getShipSpeedY() but for a specific ship (Code Level #--).

  • Method Details

    • getShipPositionX

      float getShipPositionX()
      Gets the X-axis position for the current ship (Code Level #--).
      Remember the Left edge of the screen is the X=0 position, and the X increases toward the Right edge.
      Returns:
      a floating value for the X position.

    • getShipPositionY

      float getShipPositionY()
      Gets the Y-axis position for the current ship (Code Level #--).
      Remember the Top edge of the screen is the Y=0 position, and the Y increases toward the Bottom edge.
      Returns:
      a floating value for the Y position.

    • getShipAngle

      float getShipAngle()
      Gets the current ship orientation (Code Level #--).
      The angle is in degrees. 0 means the ship goes toward the Right edge of the screen, along the X-axis. +90.0 means the ship goes toward the Bottom edge of the screen, along the Y-axis. -90.0 means the ship goes toward the To edge of the screen, along the Y-axis. +180.0 or -180.0 means the ship goes toward the Left edge of the screen, along the X-axis.
      Returns:
      a floating value between -180.0 and +180.0

    • getShipSpeed

      float getShipSpeed()
      Gets the speed magnitude for the current ship (Code Level #--).
      Returns:
      a floating value for the speed magnitude.

    • getShipSpeedX

      float getShipSpeedX()
      Gets the X-axis component of the current ship speed vector (Code Level #--).
      Remember a positive value means the vector points toward the Right edge of the screen.
      Returns:
      a floating value for the X-axis speed vector component.

    • getShipSpeedY

      float getShipSpeedY()
      Gets the Y-axis component of the current ship speed vector (Code Level #--).
      Remember a positive value means the vector points toward the Bottom edge of the screen.
      Returns:
      a floating value for the Y-axis speed vector component.

    • getShipBoostLevel

      float getShipBoostLevel()
      Gets the boost charge level. The boost is a feature that allows to briefly increase your ship speed without any energy consumption (Code Level #--).
      In order to use the boost feature, the boost level must be 'full'. To activate the boost, just call the ShipActions.useBoost() function.
      Returns:
      a floating value between 0.0 (no charge at all) and 100.0 (full charge, boost is ready).

    • getShipBatteryLevel

      float getShipBatteryLevel()
      Gets the level of the ship battery (Code Level #--).
      Depending on the race mode, the energy consumption can be enabled, and you must take care of your battery level. Some checkpoints have a 'charging' ability (you will notice them by their electric icons ), use them in order to recharge your battery. In order to recharge your battery, just place your ship over the 'charging' checkpoint and wait for charge to be complete.
      Returns:
      a floating value of the remaining battery level between 0.0 (no more energy, the race is finished) and 100.0 (full energy).

    • getShipPositionX

      float getShipPositionX​(int index)
      This function is the same than getShipPositionX() but for a specific ship (Code Level #--).
      The ship index is given in parameter.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the requested ship. This is an integer value between 0 and N-1, with N the number of ships returned by Global.getNbShips(). Be careful if the index value is out of the range, the result will be for the current ship.
      Returns:
      a floating value. See getShipPositionX() for details

    • getShipPositionY

      float getShipPositionY​(int index)
      This function is the same than getShipPositionY() but for a specific ship (Code Level #--).
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the requested ship. This is an integer value between 0 and N-1, with N the number of ships returned by Global.getNbShips(). Be careful if the index value is out of the range, the result will be for the current ship.
      Returns:
      a floating value. See getShipPositionY() for details
